item.title: Report E-2024040034
item.description:
Report E-2024040034

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-04T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: EDINBURGH
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 26, 2024, four (4) 0.5-liter bottles of UN2397 were damaged by a broken skid and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Indiana Spill Response (ISR) to remediate the impacted site. ISR personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN2397-impacted dock floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums and staged on site for transport and disposal. Crews re-palletized the undamaged freight for shipment to its destination.

item.title: Report E-2024040017
item.description:
Report E-2024040017

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-03T15:11:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-29
  • City: SOUTH BEND
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS regarding a punctured 330-gallon tote as a result of improper loading / inadequate preparation for transportation. The puncture resulted in a 1-quart release of hazardous product, Perkleen 1250- ND, that only impacted the side of the tote. A Contractor cleaned-up the release, transferred the product into a new tote, and cut-up the damaged tote. One drum was generated for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.

item.title: Report E-2024040004
item.description:
Report E-2024040004

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-03T15:11:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-29
  • City: SOUTH BEND
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XSB experienced a UN3105 Norox MEKP-9H release from a box containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 cup of material released to the box only located on the dock due to leaking, defective jug caps. The four jugs were placed into a 55-gallon vented poly drum. The impacted cardboard and PPE were placed into a separate 55-gallon vented poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024031438
item.description:
Report X-2024031438

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-18
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AN AIR PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED DUE TO A HISSING SOUND BEING HEARD COMING FROM THE PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED 4 X 10 OUNCE CANS OF DUST-OFF ELECTRONICS COMPRESSED GAS DUSTER. THERE WAS ONE CAN LEAKING FROM THE NOZZLE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM NEW YORK USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER, F3635V. THIS ACCOUNT IS NOT ASSOCIATED TO ANY VALID UPS ACCOUNT HOLDER. NO SHIPPER PICK-UP SCANS. FIRST SCAN IN THE UPS NETWORK IS IN ISLAND CITY, NEW YORK. PRIOR TO THE PACKAGE INSPECTION AND UNDECLARED DISCOVERY IN INDIANA, THE PACKAGE HAD FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT FROM EWR TO SDF.

item.title: Report X-2024031226
item.description:
Report X-2024031226

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-20
  • City: JEFFERSONVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler was not following proper handling of hazardous materials. Package handler attempted to lift the metal pail over his head to place onto the van line when he dropped the pail. As a result, the pail dented causing a puncher hole where liquid was leaking from. Ops Manager on the van line immediately contacted the quality assurance team and the spill was quickly contained. DescribePack: Metal pail has a dent on the side with a small puncher hole. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The metal pail was quickly placed in a hazmat bag with loose absorb material and placed in a hazardous spill drum and kept in the hazmat cage.
